title: Revenue share by geographic region of delivery for Christian Dior December 2018
summary: This is a bar chart representing Country in the x axis and Revenue share in the y axis.
The Revenue share is appeared to be the highest at Country Asia (excluding Japan) and lowest at Country Japan.
The highest Country Asia (excluding Japan) has 22.0 more Revenue share than the lowest Country Japan.
min_summary: This is a bar chart representing Country in the x axis and Revenue share in the y axis.
Country Asia (excluding Japan) has the highest Revenue share and Japan has the lowest Revenue share.
mid_summary: This is a bar chart representing Country in the x axis and Revenue share in the y axis.
The Revenue share is appeared to be the highest at Country Asia (excluding Japan) and lowest at Country Japan.
The highest Country Asia (excluding Japan) has 22.0 more Revenue share than the lowest Country Japan.
max_summary: This bar chart has 6 columns on the x axis representing Country, and Revenue share in each Country on the y axis.
The maximum Revenue share 29.0 is found at Country Asia (excluding Japan) and the minimum is found at Japan where Country is 7.0.
The second highest Revenue share is appeared to be the Country United States.
The difference of Revenue share between the highest and lowest Country is 22.0.
Revenue share at Country Asia (excluding Japan) is 29.0 , second place is United States at 24.0, and thirdly is Europe (excluding France) at 19.0.
Considered together, the average Revenue share in all 6 Countrys is roughly 16.67.
Summing up the values of all Countrys, we get total 100.0.
